text: Also what about Heliod vs Brave the Sands?
Gives vigilance and can make tokens and beat face.
I also don’t like the cluestones.
Or keyrunes.
dean loves cluestones
Why not run Chromatic Lantern for a 3 drop to cast your more color-intensive stuff and ramp over a cluestone.
If you’re going for 3-drop rocks.
Often Boros cards run pretty heavy on color
the boros keyrune is one of the better ones for what it is worth thopugh
That's a good point on that Phoenix. An earlier build ran more rocksm
I used to hate cluestones, but then they printed Commander's Sphere, and that was awesome, and I realized that the cluestones were just slightly worse spheres
Heliod is a thought.
For the same CMC with Lantern you don’t have to worry about your more color-intense spells.
Shard Phoenix seems like it might kill a lot of your critters
For that matter, since you’re so creature intensive, you could run [[Pillar of Origin]]

text: Never mind too many differ t types.
Do wish they’d finish the Talisman cycle.
Seems like something they could do in supplemental products like that board game.

I like running all the Thopter and servo creators as long as we have Pia Nalaar and Pia/Kiran Nalaar. Anything that produces a non flying token in this build feels pretty bad in my opinion. Why make non-flying tokens when for the same mana we can usually get flying ones. For instance, why attended knight when we could run sandsteppe outcast for the same cmc. Flying is too relevant to not run over a vanilla token.
Also, [[oketra the true]] doesn't seem too bad here. What about spear of heliod or did I miss that?

Love Bobo. So much fun
now for some cuts

I ran mine with a bare minimum of creatures.
But, that’s me
the inspiration was "play borb as fast as I can, use all the wheels and creature power draws I can find to draw all the rest of the lands in my deck and burn the world"
the lists I had seen up to this point were "ramp and find lands with search for land cards and put them in your hand"
there was one dragon that wheels from the graveyard that I was thinking too
[[Sprouting Vines]] pretty frequently gets 3 land to hand and not infrequently more
